concept.title: What is a test case library?

definition.p: An application's test case library is a collection of test scripts for each of its user interface objects. Currently, these are all executed manually. Each user interface object is developed from a set of specifications for user interface features posted on the SIL Internet.

partsAndFunctions.p: Here are the parts of a Test Case Library:

tr.td: Lists the test scripts in a test case library and provides some test content data.
A collection of test cases organized around a specific user interface object or feature.
Documents the steps needed to test a single aspect of a user interface object or feature.
A simple task that has a specified outcome.
When testing finds a bug, these patterns show how the bug is to be reported.
